name: H10 Raco Del Pi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Raco del Pi for 4 wonderful nights and found it to be exactly as people had described - fantastic! The location can't be beaten, right in the heart of everything, with tapas bars, restaurants, sights and local transport links all within a stones throw. The Ramblas is about a 10 minute walk away, with loads of little squares and alfresco bars to quench your thirst along the way!
reviews.title: Fantastic location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just as people have said, it is really quiet at night and the hotel's airconditioning is fab. Yes the rooms are small, but to be honest, the cleanliness, location and staff make up for it. We didn't have the breaksfast, as we weren't staying on a B&B basis, and it was really expensive (about 15 euros) per person, but there were loads of little places just outside so there was no problem. It did look great though so if you get a deal including breakfast then go for it!
reviews.title: Ticks all the boxes
Well-located boutique hotel
reviews.text: The only negative that we found with the location, and it is really minor, is that when the shutters go down, it is quite tricky to navigate your way back through the little winding streets to find the hotel, as all the streets look the same. It took us a few days of trundling around late at night to get our bearings in the dark, which was fun, after a few sangrias, but a little scary if you're alone i would imagine!

reviews.title: Top location, not bad little hotel
reviews.text: Also, although the cleanliness of the streets has been mentioned, their methods haven't! As a youngish girl (!) with a penchant for high heals, and a tendancy to get very sore feet late in the evening, I was quite surprised by the ritual spraying of the streets from about 1:30 in the morning onwards. I have normally kicked my heels off by this point, but I learnt my lesson pretty quickly after the 3rd night of slimy and rather yucky feet, to plan ahead and either not wear shoes that will need kicking off, or avoid the sprayers - tricky when they spray the whole of the Ramblas and gothic quarter! Not a complaint in the slightest, but something I wish I had been aware of before going out on the raz!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely go back to Raco del Pi, and would recommend it to anyone wishing to visit the grogeous Barcelona!
reviews.title: Awesome Little Hotel in the center of everything

likes.liked: — Goog pillows, Great air conditioner, Many bathroom complements.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at the H10 Raco del Pi.
reviews.title: 24 - 27 Jan 2008

likes.liked: — The position and complimentary coffee and pastries

reviews.title: A great hotel in Barcelona
reviews.text: We had a brilliant time in Barcelona and loved this hotel. We took ages to choose a hotel after reading numerous reviews and we were pleased with our choice. The hotel is tucked down a side street very close to Las Ramblas so in a brilliant location. We had complimentary cava on arrival and the complimentary coffee/tea and pastries provided throughout the day were great especially after a busy day out round the city.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff on reception spoke very good English and were very helpful. We had room 407 on the 4th floor. It is on the back of the hotel so was lovely and quite but it only had two small skylights and a very small low level window (at ankle level!) so felt a bit dark. However it was clean and had everything we needed and to be honest you dont spend much time in the room so we didnt grumble. Looking at the floorplan on the back of our door we shall ask for room 402 next time which was much larger and had a balcony, but it it is on the front of the hotel so imagine it might be a bit noisy at night at busy times of the year. We would definitely recommend this hotel, particularly because of its position.
reviews.title: great location
Loved this hotel!
reviews.text: We would also recommend using the aerobus to travel to and from the airport. It went from right outside the terminal to the centre at Placa de Catalyna and cost just 3.90 euros each. It runs every 15 mins even on Sundays and is less than a 10 min walk to the hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: The hop on hop off Turistic bus is a must. The red tour round the north of the city was more interesting and we used it to get to and from the Nou Camp.
reviews.title: Free internet a bonus
Great location, tiny (!) rooms
reviews.text: We booked a room at the hotel after reading the reviews here, and I must say we were very surprised.

reviews.title: Very friendly hotel
reviews.text: The hotel is indeed well located, and has very nice and helpful staff, but...the rooms are so tiny that we couldn't even open our suitcase. We've asked the front desk to be moved to a bigger room, but they said that our room was one of the biggest in the hotel.

reviews.title: Great Stay at ARaco Del Pi
reviews.text: Since we did want to open our suitcase and to be able to move around the room, after staying there for the first night, we moved to another hotel.

reviews.title: My favorite hotel
reviews.text: A friend and I stayed 4 nights in this centrally located, quiet, comfortable and clean hotel. The room was a bit small, but we didn't spend much time in it. The bathroom was a good size with a good shower. There were flowers in the room. The staff were very welcoming, friendly and spoke good English. The breakfast was included and was excellent with a wide choice. A very nice suprise was the tea, coffee, croissants and cakes served free all day at the bar and the free internet access.

reviews.title: Excellent hotel
reviews.text: We thought it was good value for money and would stay there again. As 2 women travelling together we found it secure and we felt safe. The location is very good, near the old cathedral, not far from a metro, but far enough from the Ramblas not to be noisy. The street opened into a lovely square with a church that held concerts and a farmers' market.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are just back from a 4 night stay at the Raco del Pi. The first thing I would say is that the location is amazing, off the Ramblas and in a lovely quiet street in the Gothic Quarter. We couldnt possibly fault the location. The hotel is pretty nice, a lovely exterior and very friendly front desk staff.
reviews.title: Did the Job

likes.disliked: — Interior and size of room and the view from the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However the hotel room was average. I found all the dark wood quite gloomy and the room was tiny. It was however very clean and well serviced.
reviews.title: Hotel added to our stay

likes.liked: — The standard of the accomodation tea bar etc.
likes.disliked: — No out -look 2003 on computer for E-Mailing easily

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Nice place. Staff was friendly, in the limited time that I spoke to them. I tend to be a pretty self sufficient traveler. I am a little torn on the area however. A friend stayed just a few hundred meters away in a hotel on Via Laitana, which was a much easier place to get to...and find. The area that this hotel is in, is a warren of ancient streets, that at night, after drinks, becomes very diffcult to navigate. However the last night I spent in BCN, late at night I had the whole Barri Gothic to myself, and as I wandered around it was so peaceful it made the whole thing worth it.
reviews.title: Nice place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Since I'm a man and less likely to get hassled, it worked for me, but for women it *may* be different. I suppose it would depend on your level of comfort/street sense.
reviews.title: Definitly worth it!

likes.liked: — Location, upkept and clean, and spacious room
likes.disliked: — Price? Nothing really to complain about.

reviews.title: Excellent hotel in great location
reviews.text: Loved this hotel!! In the middle of everything, but also quiet when you want to get some sleep. I shared the room with 2 other people and the space was ample!! We got room 201 and the ceiling was so high and the room spacious. The bathroom was really pretty with the mosaic tiles in deep blue, with double sinks! (There was also a scale, but why depress yourself when you're on vacation). We also had a small balcony that overlooked the walkable street.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Didn't take advantage of the breakfast b/c we only stayed 2 nights. But they do offer free coffee and water throughout the day and nuts to snack on.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The staff was very helpful and nice. Especially, Albert. He was the best throughout my whole week in Spain.
reviews.title: Great Location, Would (Will) Return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: I stayed here with my mother for three days. We had a spacious very calm, clean room with a very good bed and bathroom. Breakfast was good. Staff was helpfull; made all our restaurant reservations, gave helpfull tips about dinner hours in Barcelona. Free internet provided. (very handy). And the location couldn't be better, just around the corner of a lovely square, where you could hang out both for drinks (cava is only 2 euro's a glass) and tapas.
reviews.title: good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is in an old building, but with an almost completely new interior. (don't expect a romantic crooked room). It's modern, efficient, clean not cheaply furnished, but certainly not the typical spanisch "hostal". My mother was really content; it was the kind of hotel where she could have a nice rest in the afternoon from the very busy city.
reviews.title: Great City! Great Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from three nights in the Raco del Pi. A short walk to Las Ramblas and as said before a location that cannot be beat. Was in room 204 with a small balcony overlooking Carrer del Pi. Only noise at night was the garbage collection. The area is really quiet after the shops close. At night it is best to stick to the main streets and aviod the dark/quiet ones. Room was clean and functional and the staff was great. Beds were hard but did not prevent us from sleeping after touring all day. Water, pastries and coffee available daily right outside the small breakfast room.
reviews.title: A great city and a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006
reviews.text: We did have breakfast the first night at the 1/2 price rate of 7e...not worth the regular 14e rate...plenty of places to grab breakfast. Right next door is an inside shopping gallery with some cute shops including a very small family owned food counter which opens at 9:00am. Breakfast for two was about 7e. Great fresh squeezed zumo de narranja.
reviews.title: Greatest location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We tried Taller de Tapas close to the hotel and was not impressed. Prices were high and food was so-so. If you want tapas go to one of the many small tavernas. Tapas are about 1,60e each and you select right off the counter. They count the toothpicks after and charge you accordingly. Great with beer or cava. Also, go to Placa Real about a ten minute walk. Many great restaurants including Les Quintz Nitz. Join the line about 8:00 pm for the 8:30 seating. VERY reasonable...great variety and super food. Four of us had three courses and wine for 80e. And do not miss grabbing some fruit, a bocadilla or pastries at La Boqueria Market also a ten minute walk right on Las Ramblas. We used the Tourist bus and it was a great way to see the entire city if the weather is good and you can sit on top. We lucked out and it was 68-72 with no rain every day. Taxi cost about 30e to the airport as they do charge a luggage surcharge which seems to have no set rate. Many taxis cannot find the hotel. Heading up Las Ramblas.... turn right after you pass La Boqueria...then the second right on Carrer del Pi.
reviews.title: What a location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took a while to choose a hotel looking at reviews on trip advisor and finally booked on lastminuite.com.the location was great close to the Las Ramblas im a nice street that is safe at night. The room looks exactly like pictures shown the hotel website it was large in size as was bathroom very clean. breakfast was 16 euros hand a great seceltion of continental foods.if your a couple specify a king size bed as a standard double room comes with twins pushed together.
reviews.title: Great hotel fantastic location

likes.liked: — size of the room and bidet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely hotel, just off Las Ramblas. Fresh fruit in the lobby every day
reviews.title: Great value, great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007
reviews.text: and sparkling wine upon arrival. The room we stayed in seemed to have just been redone, but it may have just been perfectly maintained! There was internet access in the bar area. Would recommend to anyone who wants a good location, a little luxury, but not huge price.
reviews.title: H10, great location, clean with very hard beds!
Quirky but attractive, good but expensive
reviews.text: Used Tobook.com to book this hotel and breakfast was not included. Beds were like sleeping on boards, but room was clean and hotel is in a great location. Only stayed one night pre-cruise so no big deal, but couldn't stand to sleep on those beds more than one night. Room was 101 a triple. Beware the triple is a fold out sofabed that will leave indentations on your body from the springs.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's a little quirky - your experience depends a lot on which room you get; they vary considerably. We started in room 110, which was a dark stifling airless box with a sealed window completely overlooked by the courtyard bar. The a/c was useless and there was no hot water. If this happens to you, ask early the next morning to move to another room [they can arrange this before the following night's guests arrive] rather than ask them to repair the problems, because the latter won't happen.... We were moved to the third floor and a room with a lovely little balcony overlooking the Carrera del Pi - much more what we wanted!
reviews.title: Good if you make it so !

likes.disliked: — argument required to obtain a new room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel last minute, using Tripadvisor's links to venere.com. Thank GOD - although our cab driver didn't know where it was and we had to navigate the deliciously creepy alleys at night looking like complete Yankee tourists (yes, lots of heroin users, no, they didn't bother us), once we got there, it was like heaven. We arrived very early in the morning, around 6 am, and had to wait to check in, but luckily, they let us drop our bags off while we toured the city. They have delicious free breakfast and free internet! And once we arrived for real, we got a free glass of cava too! H10 Raco Del Pi is a glimmering oasis of calm and modernism in the gritty urban center of Barcelona. It's a stone's throw from the Ramblas and in the middle of the amazing Barri Gotic - full of small alleys and surprising plazas, home to some fanastic shopping. And you MUST try Juicy Jones, a short walk away, for the freshest tasting juices of your life.
reviews.title: Shady Alleys (Don't Trust the Cabs) But a Honeyed Gem in the Tough

likes.liked: — Free internet access and cava on check in!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ok hotel, good location If a bit noisy but that is what you get if you stay in a city centre hotel. Dont expect to get any sleep during the day up till about 10pm if you have a room at the front, you will probably also be woken by street cleaning and people walking home late at night but, its very well located.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One thing, room was clean, but we did find a cockroach on our last night. Not too familiar with them, but I assume you get them in old buildings? It was only one and was thrown out the window and didnt see anyothers. The Shower Screen didnt fit the bath so water went everywhere.
reviews.title: Excellent. Want to go back soon please!

likes.liked: — It was clean, friendly and central to everything.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Im only giving it 3 out of 5, as it was nice, but not that cheap for a 3* bit noisy but well located.
reviews.title: Great Location
Location Location Location
reviews.text: Im sure you can find better for not much more cash.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Raco Del Pi 12 months ago and, having enjoyed our stay, decided to return this year. We weren't disappointed.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We asked for a room over the street on the booking form and got a large 2nd floor room with a small balcony. There was a well stocked mini bar and in the bathroom theres just about every toiletry you need, even a passable cologne.
reviews.title: Very central, very clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Theres lots nice homely touches, like free internet access, complementary fruit, snacks and coffee, and the staff are friendly and helpful. All those we dealt with spoke perfect English.
reviews.title: Avoid this hotel - in particular single rooms!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: For a weekend break the location couldn't be better, 5 minutes from the Aerobus in Placa Catalunya and smack in the middle of the Gothic quarter. Carrer Del Pi is a pedestrian street so theres little noise to bother you at night, and theres a nice cafe in the square 50 yards away if you'd rather head out for breakfast.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Holiday!

likes.disliked: — The pastries were only put out in the afternoon so you couldn't take some out with you

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked on the strength of Tripadvisor reviews so better report back! very central, really easy to get in and out of and mercifully just out of reach of the Ramblas. All the usual 4* stuff, but very basic. We'd booked a twin and got two beds shoved up against each other (easy to move but irritating). Agree with other reviewers that the rooms are small but thanks to imaginative architecture, even the inside ones are light. Very nice to see free internet - no-one mentioned that there was complementary coffee and cake or that there is also a library of books (on the third floor). Staff were good, I'd stay there again and can see it being great if you're there for business but not my idea of a place for romance
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned after spending 3 nights at this hotel and we were very disappointed!
reviews.title: Dissappointed!

likes.disliked: — Small rooms and hard bed and pillows

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: As a result of reading some reviews, I took the trouble to email the hotel to explain that our visit was for a special occassion (our wedding anniversary) and please could we have one of the larger rooms at the front,overlooking the street.They completely ignored my letter and we were given a very small room at the back,with a view of a brick wall! I did go back to reception and they offered me the same room on another floor but with no windows!!(Although we had a window,the curtains were too narrow and there was a big gap down the middle so we were unable to make it dark...at least no one was able to see in due to being overlooked by the brick wall!)
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our room was so small that we were unable to move around the bed at the same time ,so had to take it in turns to lie on the bed to enable the other to get ready.The bathroom was ok though except the shower sprayed the floor ,and all our stuff ,until we got used to it!
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel, great location, family friendly.

likes.liked: — Location, wiew from balcony, family friendly, friendly staff, great breakfast, cleanliness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: On arrival we were offered the breakfast deal i.e.if you paid up front for all days you could have the first day half price.It was 16 Euros each! Expensive,but we decided that if we ate loads we wouldnt need to bother with lunch.This is what we did ,and it worked well.They also wanted us to pay in cash (for some reason their credit card machine was missing!) we refused as we didnt want to tie up E82 of our cash and guess what...the machine had reappeared the next morning!Very weird!
reviews.title: Friendly and central

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As it is a buffet you can obviously pick and choose but if you are not fussy it was fine.There was : fruit juices,cereals,fresh fruit (lovely selection),cheeses,hams,smoked salmon,rolls,bread,yoghurts,croissants and a good selection of other pastries.Hot food was the same every day: scrambled egg,bacon,fried egg and sausage (the german kind).it was never very hot but was quite tasty.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel , Centrally Located

likes.disliked: — Just a little noisy outside early morning.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: After reading other glowing reviews here about the H10 Raco del Pi in Barcelona, my friend and I booked a double room there more than 6 months in advance of our trip, confident it would be a great place to stay. Our flight arrived in Barcelona very early local time, so when I confirmed our reservation in writing a week in advance of our arrival, I requested early check-in. Nope! They couldn't be bothered to arrange this, not even with a week's advance notice. The hotel did not let us check in a second before 2:00 p.m. Exhausted and unbathed, up for more than 24 hours straight, we had to wander around Barcelona in a sleep-deprived stupor before many places were even open. You can't tell me they couldn't have compromised and had a clean room for us by NOON, with a week's notice, at the very least. Our room was a colossal disappointment. We had room 101, which must be very different from the guest rooms described by other reviewers. It was a dim and depressing 9' x 9' not counting the bathroom. There were no luggage racks, only two tiny sock drawers, and no place to conveniently stow luggage out of our ways, even on the floor. The "two beds" I'd requested were twin beds with about 2" of space between. If the tile floor was ever swept or mopped the whole time we were there, I'd be surprised, because my socks turned black walking on that floor. The air conditioning and air circulation was beyond abysmal; the air reeked of stale smoke and never, ever changed. Even overnight, even cranked, the air conditioning never quite cut it. Window was locked shut. The front desk staff seemed polite, professional and made earnest attempts to accommodate us, but the housekeeping staff was puzzling at best. Although there were two people in the room, the housekeeping staff only provided towels for one. When we finally got them to start providing enough towels for two, we still couldn't get them to give us an extra washcloth. We left a note with a tip of 3 Euro (we tipped every day about this amount) asking for "por favor, uno mas toallita." We returned about 2:00 that afternoon to find both the tip and the note GONE, but our room still not made up. A few minutes later, a housekeeper came by with two more towels, not washcloths. Our Spanish was not so awful that we couldn't hear her cackling to the other housekeepers outside the door about the "weirdos in 101" who wanted all the extra towels. From then on, we did not leave tips! Although the tile in the bathroom was lovely, the loose-fitting shower door inevitably allowed a lake of water to leak onto the floor during every shower, and a sole towel hook meant that one of us always had to hang her towel in the closet. The room was also poorly insulated against sound, and late-night partiers lurching around and yelling to one another through the stairwells easily woke us. Our conclusion is that this is a 2-star hotel that charges and masquerades as a 3-star hotel. Although the Barri Gotic is a fascinating neighborhood and very walkable, if you're looking for comfort and cleanliness, I'd recommend going elsewhere.
reviews.title: Can this be the same hotel everyone else here stayed at?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is excellent in middle of gothic quarter, tons of restaurants, shops, plazas, within walking distance of everything. The staff was superb - super friendly. I didn't have a converter for my cell phone charger - they had one for me to borrow so I could charge my phone. It was pouring rain one day - they had umbrellas for the guests to borrow. Free internet access in lobby so you can check your email. Our room had a balcony overlooking the street and was a beautiful view, the bathroom had slate tiled floors, 2 sinks, and a jetted bathtub with shower, fresh flower. You should request a quiet room with a view for these types of things, the hotel usually complies and there is no extra fee for these "nicer" rooms. The rooms furniture and accents are also new and updated. Feels like the hotel just opened a few months ago.
reviews.title: Fabulous Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: Cons:
reviews.title: A wonderful little hotel

likes.liked: — The personal touch, an overall great package

reviews.title: Great hotel, location and city
reviews.text: The hotel is in an area that is not serviced by cars, but alhtough we couldn't take a taxi into the hotel, the hotel was able to arrange a taxi from the hotel door to get to the airport.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2005
reviews.text: Great location of this hotel. Just a short distance to so many tourist attractions, the Cathedral, Las Ramblas and Barri Gotic. Many things to choose from for Breakfast scrambled eggs, sausage (like a hot dog), pastries, cold cuts and cereals. It is in a shopping area so if you need to pick up a gift item it is very convenient. Our room had two twin beds pushed close together. Our non smoking room faced the inner courtyard so we had no problem with noise or smoking smells from others. You need to have the room key in the slot by the door in order for the air conditioning to work. It does take a while for the room to cool down but was comfortable to sleep in. Staff was friendly and helpful with directions. Also it was nice to have internet to send a quick message back to family.
reviews.title: Great Location to Barri Gotic, Cathedral and Las Ramblas
Great Hotel
reviews.text: Would definitely stay here again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We absolutely loved this hotel. It is conveniently located in the heart of the old city, only minutes from the metro and La Rambla. We had a great room on the 4th floor, and though it overlooked th pedestrian area, we did not find the noise at night to be a problem. The room was a good size and the bathroom was not to be believed. The staff was very friendly, greeted us cheerfully every morning and every evening; answered all our questions, provided restaurant recommendations, provided directions, etc. The late afternoon snacks in the lounge area were a bonus. Can't say enough good things about this hotel.
reviews.title: Great, convenient hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fabulous hotel! Great location, close to everything. Ask for room #202. HUGE room with a jetted tub, that is wonderful after walking around all day. Very clean and quiet, small balcony overlooking the shopping area.
reviews.title: Fabulous!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Free internet and champagne everyday. Front staff alittle snooty and not to smart about where things are, considering they live in Spain and work with tourists, but that can be overlooked for the great room and location.
reviews.title: Okay, but does not live up to the hype

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Have stayed in many 5 star hotels and would definatly come back to the Raco Del Pi!
reviews.title: Hotel was really lovely ...

likes.liked: — Size of room, and closeness to heart of town
likes.disliked: — dark streets on way back after a night out,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location - absolutely excellent. You couldn't wish for better. Easy walking distance to La Rambla and the underground.
reviews.title: A terrible experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a two night stay at H10 Raco Del Pi. The hotel is very good, with efficient service.For being in a very central location I can't believe how tranquil the hotel was.
reviews.title: Good all Rounder

likes.disliked: — Window in our room did not open the handle had been removed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Breakfast had a lovely continental spread with cheeses fruit pastries and bacon and eggs. During the afternoon 1pm to 9pm you could have complimentary tea,coffee and pastries in the bar.
reviews.title: Great position

likes.disliked: — Concrete floors and noise pollution from other hotel rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were small but had all the amenities that you need. The main thing was it was very clean. I have posted some photos of both the bedroom and the bathroom for you to make you own mind up.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My score - 8/10
reviews.title: Fabulous Location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would I use it again - yes.
reviews.title: Great location

likes.disliked: — Small bedroom window at floor level

aka: h10 Raco Del Pi Hotel Barcelona
description: Considered as part of Barcelona’s cultural heritage in itself, this historic building dates from the 19th century and is situated in the city’s ancient Gothic Quarter. The setting of the H10 Raco del Pi makes it ideal for exploring the narrow streets of the most atmospheric area of the city – the Gothic Quarter. Here you will find the Cathedral along with a wide range of shops, galleries and restaurants. Only 100 metres away is the vibrant Las Ramblas, and 300 metres away is the central Plaça Catalunya. On arrival you will be greeted with a glass of cava, before continuing into the charming and traditional inner courtyard. The historic building has been brought up to date with features such as a glass-walled atrium and cooling parquet floors in each room.
